item.title: Fixed, Please lock
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“geel9, post:1, topic:266530”][quote author=dylan_0789 link=topic=351627.msg2700563#msg2700563 date=1236562347]

At least CJ isn’t a total ass.

Yeah, it’s my first model–it sucks. Anyways, since I’m going to change it later: How do I triangulate it? Is there a tool or must it all be done by hand?

on metaseq. go File> and uncheck “Basic Mode”. then hit CTRL+A click ‘selected’ then hit triangulate.
and your model doesnt suck, just change the hilt. you can start with a cube, scale it, subdivide it, and extrude it to create the hilt.
[/quote]

subdivide? Extrude?

Brain functions failing.[/quote]
heh. want me to make a hilt for you?

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed, Please lock
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“geel9, post:1, topic:266521”]At least CJ isn’t a total ass.

Yeah, it’s my first model–it sucks. Anyways, since I’m going to change it later: How do I triangulate it? Is there a tool or must it all be done by hand?[/quote]
on metaseq. go File> and uncheck “Basic Mode”. then hit CTRL+A click ‘selected’ then hit triangulate.
and your model doesnt suck, just change the hilt. you can start with a cube, scale it, subdivide it, and extrude it to create the hilt.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed, Please lock
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

Assassins Creed Fan:

would still look like the nazi symbol

Get a fucking life. It’s a “symbol”. It only does damage if you continue to assosiate it (it used to be used in coca cola adverts). Plus, it’s wrong. If you look at it from the receiving end of the sword, which shapes on swords are supposed to be interpreted, it’s backwards. The symbol appears in many cultures so it’s impossible to find its exact origin.

I like the sword. As a replica not bad. If you choose to make it more original, perhaps ajust the blade with a curve. Just my thoughts.

Read full topic
